text: <@U221LL03Z>  actually it is some sort of sybil attack - if somebody has control of one of the membership services... but I believe keithsmith and also similar answer in <#C0Z4NBUN6|fabric-consensus-dev> both answers provide similar explanation that in v1 it can be noncritical to lose control over membership service with correct architecture as there are can be many root CA and having more peers (which can be started when you have control over CA) doesn't give you control over the whole network.
Hi everyone, just a quick update on what the membership services squad activities.  If you want more info on any of this, just let me know

•	TLS bug in v0.6 (FAB-392)
<http://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/1607>

•	Bootstrapping orderers / peers
A bootstrap admin uses a bootstrap tool to create a genesis block containing trusted root certs, PBFT config, etc.
See discussion in FAB-359

•	COP client/server/certMgr CLI and lib framework
See <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1651>
Currently GRPC only, but may be switching to REST based on CFSSL serve.  Investigating.

Next

•	Running COP server using CFSSL REST endpoints + tcert endpoint, if can add security without being too intrusive.
•	Running COP server in cluster
